review: I have owned Google Chromecast and most recently the Fire TV Stick. Both have their strengths and weaknesses.Ultimately I like the Amazon Fire TV Stick more because of one key factor: Amazon Prime. Most shoppers here probably have Amazon Prime, so why not make the use of it by being able to stream Prime to your TV? Google Chromecast does not include the Amazon App, so unless you have another functioning means like a Blu-Ray player, video game console, or SMART TV that has this capability - then the Google Chromecast is not the way to go.However, the Amazon Fire TV stick has one functionality flaw that Google Chromecast wins at: the ability to cast websites or stream local files directly to your TV. Amazon Fire TV Stick can stream local files by means of a third party app "Plex" - but this service is subscription based or a one time hefty fee. I do in fact pay for this service, but I would much rather have it as an added value feature that comes with the Amazon Fire TV Stick.Also, the handheld remote makes things a lot easier to navigate than the Google Chromecast. Instead of having to use my laptop to cast what I want played, I can just flick through whatever app I want and get streaming.I think if Amazon added more value to the device, then they would steal the market hands-down. I look forward to any updates and upgrades they may launch. I am ultimately happy despite the fact that I have to pay a subscription fee to stream local files.
